title: Govt. pushes ahead with new Tourism Act despite industry concerns
byline: Sri Lanka’s government is moving forward with plans for a new Tourism Act to overhaul the sector’s administrative framework, despite concerns from some private sector stakeholders over potential bureaucratic hurdles.

title: New measures to reduce device prices and regulate second-hand electronics
byline: Sri Lanka is planning a multi-pronged strategy to address the high cost of digital devices by exploring the targeted subsidies and affordable payment schemes, while simultaneously moving to formalise the second-hand market through a new registration process, aimed at curtailing the informal “grey market”.

title: Visa failure forces SL Karate team’s return from BIA empty-handed
byline: Thirty-one competitors representing the Sri Lanka Karate Federation were forced to return home empty-handed on September 2 after failing to obtain visas to attend the 23rd Asian Cadet, Junior and Under-21 Championships in Shaoguan, China, scheduled from September 5–7.

title: Lisbon in shock after funicular crash leaves 15 dead
byline: Portugal is in shock after 15 people lost their lives in the derailment of the 140-year-old Gloria funicular, a major tourist attraction in the capital Lisbon.

title: U.S. trade team to visit SL for talks on tariff implementation
byline: A team from the Office of the United States Trade Representative will be in Sri Lanka by the middle of this month to assist the government authorities in working out modalities for the implementation of reciprocal tariffs, Daily Mirror learns.

title: Trump appeals to US Supreme Court to rule on legality of tariffs
byline: President Donald Trump has asked the US Supreme Court to overturn a lower court decision that found many of his sweeping tariffs were illegal.

title: Bribery and corruption cases flood commission in 2025
byline: Over 1,000 bribery complaints, including allegations against several high-profile politicians, remain under investigation, according to the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: CEB workers launch work-to-rule campaign tonight against restructuring
byline: All electricity workers, including engineers, have decided to launch a work-to-rule campaign from tonight in protest against the restructuring of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB), which they claim is not in line with the provisions of the Electricity Amendment Act.

title: Doctors call off strike at Ratnapura Hospital
byline: The three-day strike launched by doctors at the Ratnapura Teaching Hospital was called off at noon today (04), the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) said.

title: Sajith not summoned by CID: SJB MP
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa has not been summoned by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), according to Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Harshana Rajakaruna.

title: Shashindra Rajapaksa moves High Court after Magistrate refuses bail
byline: Former Minister Shashindra Rajapaksa, who is currently in remand custody over charges under the Public Property Act, has filed a bail application before the Colombo High Court.

title: Colombo High Court rejects medical, media excuses in public property misuse case
byline: The Colombo High Court today rejected a request by President’s Counsel Sanjeewa Rajaratnam, appearing for former Minister Nalin Fernando, that his client be allowed to appear only after the commencement of trial due to adverse media publicity.

title: Ratnapura hospital director transferred amidst protest
byline: Director of the Ratnapura Teaching Hospital, Dr. Imesh Prathapasinghe, has been transferred following allegations of authoritarian conduct, which triggered a two-day strike by doctors at the hospital.

title: Cabinet cancels housing concessions for MPs
byline: The Cabinet has approved to abolish the concessional payment scheme granted to former Members of Parliament (MPs) for the purchase of houses from the Viyathpura Housing Complex.

title: Rising cases of child abuse and pregnancies reported: NCPA
byline: The National Child Protection Authority (NCPA) has reported a sharp rise in child abuse cases during the first seven months of this year.

title: Government postpones VAT implementation on electronic services
byline: The Cabinet approval has been granted to postpone the implementation of Value Added Tax (VAT) on services provided by non-resident persons through electronic platforms to Sri Lankan consumers.

title: Appeal Court dismisses Midigama Ruwan’s petition against STF in Boossa Prison
byline: A writ petition filed by Ruwan Kumara, also known as Midigama Ruwan, an alleged leading figure in the underworld, seeking the removal of the Police Special Task Force (STF) personnel from the Boossa Prison, was dismissed today by the Court of Appeal.

title: Cabinet nod to close 33 state enterprises
byline: The Cabinet has approved the closure and liquidation of 33 non-operational government enterprises.

title: School admission circulars cancelled
byline: The Cabinet has granted approval to cancel all existing circulars related to the admission of students from Grade 2 to Grade 11 in government schools, with the exception of Grades 5 and 6.

title: Over 51,900 pass scholarship exam; top score 198
byline: The Department of Examinations said that 51,969 students, representing 17.11% of candidates, have passed the 2025 Grade 5 Scholarship Examination.

title: Govt. considers handing over Mahinda Rajapaksa’s official residence to CID
byline: The government is considering handing over the official residence on Wijerama Road, Colombo, currently occupied by former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, to the Criminal Investigation Department (CID).

title: Lady doctor arrested for driving luxury car with fake number plates
byline: The Kandy Divisional Crimes Investigation Bureau arrested a lady doctor who was driving a luxury car with fake number plates.

title: Former Church of Ceylon Bishop Kenneth Fernando passes away
byline: Former Colombo Bishop of the Church of Ceylon Right Rev. Kenneth James Fernando passed away after serving the faithful for almost 70 years.

title: BASL warns against threats of legal action against attorneys
byline: The Bar Association of Sri Lanka (BASL) has raised concern over recent instances in which individuals have threatened legal action or complaints against Attorneys-at-Law in connection with professional work carried out on behalf of their clients.

title: Child cancer cases on the rise in Sri Lanka
byline: The National Cancer Control Programme (NCCP) has reported an increase in child cancer cases in Sri Lanka, with nearly 900 new cases diagnosed annually.

title: Japan’s first resumed Yen-loan project completed: Habarana–Veyangoda transmission line opened
byline: In what appears to be a major boost to the energy sector, the Habarana-Veyangoda transmission line project was opened at the new Habarana grid substation, according to a statement from the Japanese embassy.

title: Backhoe Saman’s wife remanded
byline: Shadhika Lakshani, the wife of currently detained ’Backhoe Saman’, was ordered to be remanded till September 18.

title: Bimal holds talks with Saudi Ports Authority Chief in Jeddah
byline: Sri Lanka’s Minister of Transport, Highways, Ports, and Civil Aviation, Bimal Rathnayake, met with Eng. Suliman bin Khalid Al-Mazroua, President of the Saudi Ports Authority (MAWANI), on the sidelines of the 2nd Sustainable Maritime Industry Conference in Jeddah.

title: High Court to hear Chandrani Bandara’s corruption case again
byline: The Colombo High Court today ordered that the corruption case against former Minister Chandrani Bandara be taken up again on September 23.

title: Special project to resolve missing persons cases by 2027
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved a special project to accelerate investigations into complaints of missing and disappeared persons.

title: Cabinet approves procurement of immunoglobulin vials
byline: The Cabinet has approved the procurement of 120,000 vials of Human Immunoglobulin BP (5–6 grams) for intravenous use, required for the treatment of patients with immunity deficiencies.

title: Former National Lotteries Board Director further remanded
byline: Former National Lotteries Board Director Thusitha Halloluwa, who was arrested in connection with an assault and shooting incident targeting his own vehicle, was ordered to be further remanded until September 18 by Colombo Additional Magistrate Lahiru Silva today.

title: Another bus accident in Ella, about 30 injured
byline: A bus carrying employees of the Tangalle Municipal Council on an excursion toppled down a 250-metre precipice along the Ella–Wellawaya main road today.

title: Cops salute fake police Jeep
byline: A luxury jeep modified to resemble an official police vehicle—and even saluted by genuine officers—was seized by Kandy police during a raid yesterday morning.

title: Giorgio Armani, billionaire Italian fashion designer, dies at 91
byline: Giorgio Armani, the billionaire designer who established one of the world’s most revered fashion labels and helped define the “Made in Italy” slogan as a sign of quality for consumers, has died. He was 91.

title: Two Pakistanis linked to Kehelbaddara Padme’s ICE drug facility in Nuwara Eliya: Minister
byline: Public Security Minister Ananda Wijepala said investigations have revealed that organised crime gangs had brought in foreign nationals to run an ICE drug manufacturing facility allegedly funded by underworld figure Kehelbaddara Padme in the Nuwara Eliya area.

title: Court orders evaluation of gold seized from Backhoe Saman’s wife
byline: Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama instructed the Criminal Investigation Department to submit 40 pounds of gold jewellery, seized from Shadhika Lakshani, the wife of alleged underworld figure ’Backhoe Saman’ to the National Gem and Jewellery Authority for evaluation and to obtain a report.

title: Pakistan cricketer Haider Ali cleared of rape charges in UK: Report
byline: Pakistan cricketer Haider Ali has received massive relief as he has been cleared of the rape charges in the UK. The Greater Manchester Police found no conclusive evidence against the cricketer and have decided not to go ahead with the investigation.

title: CSE recovers slightly after previous day’s decline
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) recorded another session of heightened volatility on September 4, 2025, mirroring the trading pattern of the previous day. Despite wide intraday swings, the market managed to close marginally higher, offsetting Wednesday’s decline. Intraday volatility remained elevated, with a fluctuation of 107 points between the day’s high and low.

title: Daily Mirror Brief: Daily News Recap, Top Headlines & Must-Read Stories - 4th September
byline: Daily Mirror Brief is your daily news digest—bringing you the top headlines, key updates, and essential stories you may have missed across politics, tech, culture, and global affairs. Quick, clear, and curated—your trusted news recap, whenever you’re ready.

title: Appeal Court halts trial against Ministry Secretary Ravi Seneviratne
byline: The Court of Appeal today issued an interim order suspending trial proceedings in the case against Secretary to the Ministry of Public Security and retired Senior DIG Ravi Seneviratne, which is currently before the Mount Lavinia Magistrate’s Court.

title: Man hijacks police jeep in Tissamaharama
byline: An individual hijacked a police jeep in which four police officers had set off to Pannagamuwa, Tissamaharama to settle a dispute.

title: Whether he goes from village to village or house to house, Namal has no chance: Minister Wasantha
byline: Former MP Namal Rajapaksa has no chance of electoral success, even if he campaigns from village to village or house to house, Minister Wasantha Samarasinghe said.
